name: clmfgrp

stmt.origin: syl(wcel(c0, cclm), wcel(c1, cgrp), wcel(c0, clmod))
stmt.pretty: syl(c0 ∈ CMod, c1 ∈ Grp, c0 ∈ LMod)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cclm), wcel(c1, cgrp))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cclm), wcel(c0, clmod))
-| wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, cgrp))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ CMod → c1 ∈ Grp)
⊣ (c0 ∈ CMod → c0 ∈ LMod)
⊣ (c0 ∈ LMod → c1 ∈ Grp)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cclm), wcel(c1, cgrp))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cclm), wcel(c0, clmod))
-| wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, cgrp))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ CMod → c1 ∈ Grp)
⊣ (c0 ∈ CMod → c0 ∈ LMod)
⊣ (c0 ∈ LMod → c1 ∈ Grp)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cclm), wcel(c1, cgrp))
-| wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, cgrp))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ CMod → c1 ∈ Grp)
⊣ (c0 ∈ LMod → c1 ∈ Grp)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, cgrp))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(csca, c0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cclm), wcel(c1, cgrp))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(csca, c0))

comment: The scalar ring of a subcomplex module is a group. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 16-Oct-2015.)
